variable.name: Generic Flavour
variable.description: This string refers to a class located in sfa.generic that describes which specific implementation needs to be used for api, manager and driver objects. PlanetLab users do not need to change this setting.

variable.name: Human readable name
variable.description: The human readable name for this interface.

variable.name: Credential Schema
variable.description: The path to the default credential schema

variable.name: Debug
variable.description: Logging level; 0=minimum, 1=info, 2=debug

variable.name: Max Slice Renew
variable.description: Maximum amout of days a user can extend/renew their slices to

variable.name: User Session Keys Path
variable.description: Some services will peform operations on behalf of a user, but make it look like the user is the one performing the operation. Doing this requires a valid key pair and credential for the user. This option defines the path where key pairs and credentials are generated and stored. This functionality is used by the SFA web GUI.

variable.name: Data Directory
variable.description: Directory where cached certficiates and other data is stored.

category.name: Registry
category.description: The settings that affect the registry that will run as part of this SFA instance.

variable.name: Enable Registry
variable.description: Allows this local SFA instance to run as a registry.

variable.name: Hostname
variable.description: The hostname where the registry is expected to be found; using localhost when the local registry is enabled seems reasonable.

variable.name: Port number
variable.description: The port where the registry is to be found.

variable.name: Root Authority
variable.description: The hrn of the registry's root auth.

category.name: Slice Manager
category.description: The settings that affect the slice manager that will run as part of this SFA instance.

variable.name: Enable Slice Manager
variable.description: Allows this local SFA instance to run as a slice manager.

variable.name: Hostname
variable.description: The hostname where the slice manager is expected to be found.

variable.name: Port number
variable.description: The port where the slice manager is to be found.

variable.name: Cache advertisement rspec
variable.description: Enable caching of the global advertisement, as returned by ListResources without a slice argument.

category.name: Aggregate
category.description: The settings that affect the aggregate manager that will run as part of this SFA instance.

variable.name: Enable Aggregate
variable.description: Allows this local SFA instance to run as an aggregate manager.

variable.name: Hostname
variable.description: The hostname where the aggregate is expected to be found.

variable.name: Port number
variable.description: The port where the aggregate is to be found.

variable.name: Cache advertisement rspec
variable.description: Enable caching of the global advertisement, as returned by ListResources without a slice argument.

category.description: The settings that tell this SFA instance where to find its database. You can essentially leave this as-is unless you plan on hosting your data on some other box.

variable.name: Enabled
variable.description: Enable the database server on this machine.

variable.name: Database host
variable.description: The host where the SFA database can be reached.

variable.name: Database port
variable.description: The port where the SFA database can be reached.

variable.name: Database user
variable.description: When SFA gets co-hosted with a myplc, this should match the PLC config.

variable.name: Database password
variable.description: When SFA gets co-hosted with a myplc, this should match the PLC config.

variable.name: Database name
variable.description: SFA database name.

category.name: SFA Flash Policy
category.description: The settings that affect the flash policy server that will run as part of this SFA instance.

variable.name: Enable Flash Policy Server
variable.description: Allows this local SFA instance to run a flash policy server.

variable.name: Flash policy config file
variable.description: The path to where the flash policy config file can be reached.

variable.name: Flash policy port
variable.description: The flash policy server port.
